body_html:
Hi,
I didn't notice this before. This change may be slightly counter-productive in some situations, for example where RDMA networking is in use and the SubAllocator does registration/deregistration on every alloc/free. A better approach might be to fix BFCAllocator so that its performance is better on small allocations. @nhasabni do you have any insight into what gives rise to the performance difference you're seeing?

body:
Hi,
I didn't notice this before.  This change may be slightly counter-productive in some situations, for example where RDMA networking is in use and the SubAllocator does registration/deregistration on every alloc/free.  A better approach might be to fix BFCAllocator so that its performance is better on small allocations.  @nhasabni do you have any insight into what gives rise to the performance difference you're seeing?
